name: Run Experiment
description: Maps the containers to available hosts and runs the experiment.

configStructure.name: rosMasterURI
configStructure.description: Connect to provided ROS MASTER URI if ROS Core Host is set to 'None'. Has the form of 'http://<IP Address>:<Port Number>'

configStructure.name: rosNamespace
configStructure.description: Sets the ROS_NAMESPACE for the experiment.

configStructure.name: waitTime
configStructure.description: How long to wait (in seconds) between spawning of processes.

configStructure.name: launchWithValgrind
configStructure.description: If true, spawns ROSMOD nodes with valgrind - the stderr will contain valgrind's output. Note: Make sure valgrind is installed on all target systems!

configStructure.name: forceIsolation
configStructure.description: If true, enforces that the spawned processes must run on hosts which are not currently running other ROSMOD processes.

configStructure.name: spawnROSBridge
configStructure.description: If true, it will spawn a ROS Bridge server on the ROSMOD server that connects to the system

configStructure.name: rosBridgePort
configStructure.description: What port number should we give ROSBridge server? Leave blank for a randomly assigned port

configStructure.name: rosBridgeServerIp
configStructure.description: What is the ROS_IP of the rosbridge server - this is the IP that the nodes in the system will use to connect to the rosbridge server.

configStructure.name: returnZip
configStructure.description: If true, it enables the client to download a zip of the artifacts.
